data.text: @ericviau @CBCNB I blame selfish people. The "Ma Freedums" and privilege of a certain group and those adjacent is enraging.

@CBCNB I see a headline and I research the living shit out of it. Whether I start on a CBC news site I end up on others. I have accounts on Gettr, Gab, Parler etc. 

The only difference is I stop at getting advice from YouTube or a “Quick read this before it’s deleted”.
@CBCNB No Trudeau and our elected officials did and it needs to be reported truthfully.. Not as a narrative from CBC . #werearealltherealreporters
@CBCNB No oh no.  It was the government and mainstream media that pushed and pulled apart people.   Judgement Day Is coming soon.
@ME90679543 @CBCNB Not just that turd, but also public health leaders from many other countries, like the UK, Denmark, Ireland, Sweden, Norway, Iceland, South Africa, and many others.
@Zlata66204550 @CBCNB I guess they were infiltrated lately.

@JohnOQuinn16 @CBCNB And that all people are easily influenced by fear. For some people that leads to conspiracy theories. For others, it leads them to sacrifice overall well-being and social health for small reductions in risk from disease.

@CBCNB It wasn't the pandemic per se, it was the politicization of vaccines and mask use that caused most of the divide. Unfortunately, too many people listened to that turd that used to occupy the White House instead of our own govs experts.
